name: Holiday Inn London-Heathrow M4, JCT 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed with park and stay offer on the way back from a long haul
reviews.title: does the job for a cheap overnighter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: A good start to the holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In need of good refirb, shabby and large stain on carpet also paintwork chipped marked
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: tea coffee facitlies
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, nice lobby area, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bed
reviews.title: Would not stay here again.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights-after vising Cornwall, and before returning to Texas. We chose the airport loction as it is much cheaper than hotels closer to the city, and for the convenience when flying out.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First point-beware that there are 3 Holiday Inn's Heathrow. Two of them on Sipson Rd and Sipson Way-easy to confuse! Also beware that some of the reviews posted for this hotel are for a Holiday Inn Express, and others mixed in as well. This hotel is MF, JCT 4 (whatever that means), on Sipson Way, not Sipson Rd.
reviews.title: Why did I get excited about an upgrade?

reviews.text: We booked our room through Hotwire and paid appx US$80, a very good rate.
reviews.title: Avoid This Hotel. Terrible!

reviews.text: We came from the airport and were dropped at the wrong hotel (Sipson Rd location). The hotel staff at this location were not helpful or apologetic at all that we were dropped at the wrong location, and offered no help, other than to call a taxi for us. After about a 15 min wait, a "taxi" came around who said he would take us to the other hotel for 20 pounds (1 mile away). We said no way, I would rather walk. Another legitimate taxi driver dropped someone off, and he said, it would be no more that 7 pounds on his meter. That said, I think the hotel clerks at the Sipson Rd location have a bit of a scam going with this other "taxi" driver for unsucpecting tourists like ourselves. I'm sure it happens on a daily basis that someone gets dropped at the wrong location!
reviews.title: Excellent overnight stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, the hotel on Sipson Way was very nice. The rooms were large and comfortable. The "sofabed", was actually a trundle, where a twin pulls out from under another twin bed. Your kids don't have to sleep together, so everyone is more happy!
reviews.title: Simply fantastic!

reviews.text: Parking very difficult and cost £10 a night. Reception area, bar, restaurant were OK. Check-in staff were pleasant and attentive. I had an exec room (?!) on 6th floor. Everything was shabby - carpet, furnishings were worn and in need of replacing. Outside window was filthy, curtains were dusty and generally grubby. Bathroom - pubic hairs on the floor around the edges of the bath, sink area and walls - like they only clean up the middle. Tiles had been badly replaced, yellowing grout, rusty fixing (grab handles etc) and a poor shower. I had to ask for toilet paper because there wasn't any. I also had to ask for a TV remote - poor choice of channels available. The internet was expensive - but regardless was broken anyway. Why don't they have free wireless in every room? Very dissapointed. No 'comments' card in the room - either they're fed up with the negative feedback or everyone feels the need to fill one in and they keep running out! There are more than one Holiday Inn at Heathrow - this was M4 Jct14 one.
reviews.title: Shabby, dirty & over priced. Not normal Holiday Inn standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 1 night at the holiday inn (M4,J4) before flying out to Rome. And in the sense that it was only marginally more expensive then parking at T3 plus very convenient in the morning it was good. In every other respect it was not. We were on the 11th floor which was dirty and shabby and the furniture in our room was falling apart. We paid £10 each for breakfast in the morning when we arrived, yet when we went to the restaurant they hadn't put our names down which was frustrating as we held up the queue while sorting it out (which was embarrasing). Overall our experience was poor and I definitely won't be staying here again next time I fly out of Heathrow.
reviews.title: expected little, got less

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of the other reviews appear to be mixing up the Holiday Inns at Heathrow, but I'm reviewing the one I stayed at next to junction 4 of the M4. I've passed this large hotel for years on my way into London, (it was orginally a Posthouse hotel), so having stayed at many of the hotels at Heathrow, was interested to see for myself what it was like.
reviews.title: The big one next to M4 junction 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got the best price I've had at a Heathrow hotel for this visit, £65 for room only plus15 days parking included, (is that good or what?).
reviews.title: One time only!
A rip off
reviews.text: The car park was pretty full, so along with lots of others I parked on the grass that Tuesday night. The hotel ask you to sign a form to agree to allow your car to be moved to another secure location during your stay. This was new for me because I've left my car at the Sheritan, Crown Plaza and Renaisance, (that's two spelling mistakes already), without needing to do this. You leave your key with reception they move the car and then return the car to hotel, before your return. As it happens, they did not move my car and it was where I left it on my return, possibly because I was only away for 5 days. The car park was also fairly empty on my return on the Sunday night.
I booked a single night through Hotwire and got a £40 room. Took the 222 bus from Hounslow West and was in my room within 10 minutes of arrival. There was no wait at reception with 3 people on staff.
reviews.title: Hotwire&Oyster Card made this a great deal

reviews.text: Room was clean, spacious most importantly had lovely flat screen TV so I could watch the first episode of Downton Abbey season 2!
reviews.title: Good location - ok hotel

reviews.text: In the morning took the 222 again and was at Heathrow in 30 minutes. Much more economical and efficient than the Hotel Hoppa.
reviews.title: Comfortable, but...

reviews.text: I have booked again for my next holiday departure from Heathrow
reviews.title: Lovely Overnight Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night prior to our flight from Heathrow. We booked with car parking for 10 nights which was quite good value.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but basic
A bit hit & miss
reviews.text: We (husband & I) stayed here on Saturday 6th June overnight prior to a short holiday. We got a good deal through Holiday Extras, which included parking for 8 days, but not breakfast. When we checked in, we were offered an upgrade to an Executive Room, breakfast for both of us and a taxi to Heathrow the next morning. As we were flying from Terminal 4 and the Hoppa Bus didn't go there, we knew we'd have to get a taxi anyway, so we took up the upgrade. The cost of this was £42, but value for money for us as breakfast is around £16 each, a taxi would be similar cost, so it was worth it for us to take the upgrade.

The room was quite large, decent size bed, wooden doors at the window instead of curtains, a tv, desk, executive style chair, and a sofa. The bathroom was clean with plenty of toiletries and a good shower.
reviews.title: Grandy near Heathrow

reviews.text: We were out on the Saturday evening at a family event so didn't use any of the bars in the hotel, except for a late night drink on our return, which was quite pricey. Breakfast was usual buffet style, nothing majorly impressive, usual fruit, juices, bacon, eggs etc, although you can request an omelette freshly made. The breafast area isn't large so gets a bit noisy but times are good 7am-11am on Saturdays and Sundays. The taxi arrived promptly at the time we requested.
reviews.title: what a place

reviews.text: We returned to the hotel for an overnight stay on Friday 12th June. This booking was made via the Holiday Inn website, again for a good rate which included breakfast. There initially seemed to be a little confusion on our arrival, at 7pm. We had the impression our room had been given to someone else but they offered us a free upgrade to an Executive room, once they checked one was ready. We had room 130, which was just like the one we had for our stay the previous Saturday night. This time we had the extra luxury of a bathrobe.
reviews.title: Don't stay here - would be more comfortable sleeping at the airport!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the pub at the end of the drive - The Plough and relaxed with a drink - can only recommend here as much cheaper than hotel and it was still warm enough to sit outside last night and their food is great too. We returned to our room at about 10pm and went to make a cup of tea only to find no tea bags or coffee in the dish. I phoned house-keeping to request tea bags, which they promised to bring. At 10.25pm I phoned again as they hadn't arrived. My call was transferred to room service and I again requested tea bags and some more milk. My tea bags, but no more milk finally arrived at 10.40pm. I didn't phone reception to complain because by now I just wanted my cup of tea and to go to sleep.
reviews.title: Good hotel to start or finish a trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night between flights. The hotel is what I expected, some good points, some not so good. Check in was fast and friendly. The room was small, but adequate for an overnight stay. The king bed was comfortable, but the pillows were small and not so comfortable. The bathroom gets a mixed review also. The shower worked well with plenty of hot water, but needs to be remodeled. Although it was clean on the surface, the tile grout and tub sealant showed signs of mildew and needs to be replaced.
reviews.title: Convenient for one night

reviews.text: We ate the 9.95 pound breakfast and thought it was a decent value. Good coffee, plenty of food, hot and cold, and a good variety of choices to eat.
reviews.title: Convenient place to stay

reviews.text: I would consider staying here again, but only if it was for a one night layover between flights. For anything longer I'm sure there are better places to stay.
reviews.title: In Need of Update

reviews.text: Took hoppa bus from heathrow. Be warned driver did not have a clue. Argued with me that there was more than one Holiday Inn with Drayton address.....shocking I feel sorry for any tourists.
reviews.title: Good place to stay before your Heathrow flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reservation was fouled up with wrong date but it may have been British Midland who did that not sure. Clerk was very good and sorted out also gave upgrade on room.
reviews.title: bargain!!!

reviews.text: The main thing I want from a stop over hotel is a clean room and comfy night's sleep. Check in was simple and efficient. The room was very quiet, which is a must. We had booked a bedroom to accommodate myself, wife and son. The room had a double bed and the sofa bed was already made. There was a good flat screen TV with plenty of channels. Tea/coffee facility in room was rather poor. It looked set up for 1 guest as there was only 1 of each choice (1 sachet of decaf, 1 sachet of regular etc) and more importantly 1 cup. We called reception for another 2 cups and after waiting over half an hour called them again. They said that they had been but there was a "do not disturb" sign on the door. Our fault, I didn't realise my wife had put it on. It was still a long time before somebody came to bring more bedding???? I explained again that all we wanted (almost an hour ago) was 2 more cups. At this point we just wanted to get to sleep, but the cups eventually arrived. Unfortunately we all fancied tea, but there wasn't enough.
reviews.title: Serves it's purpose perfectly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know about facilities or if wifi costs, but I would happily stay again. I haven't deducted a mark for the cup incident, I just couldn't give it 5 as it is further than most hotels (maybe an advantage for aircraft noise) and there just wasn't anything that made me think "wow" I love this hotel.
reviews.title: Good clean hotel for a stopover.

reviews.text: Stayed here for a stopover through Heathrow, and I must say, we were pleasantly surprised. We had booked a breakfast included rate @57 pounds, King bed, non-smoking - couldn't be beat at that price for location. The hotel is only a short 10 minute cab ride at a cost of 13 pounds. The other option was to line up to board the Hoppa Bus which travels between all 5 terminals for 4 pounds per person, no interest in that after an 8 hour flight. The lobby is clean and modern, with a 24 hour lounge and bar menu, an oriental restaurant, and the main Buffett restaurant. We had breakfast at the Buffett, and it was very good, with a lot of wait staff on, so I never had to ask for my plate to be taken away or for another cup of coffee. Lots of choices of hot and cold foods, something for everyone. The room was clean and in good shape, no broken or damaged furniture could be seen. Very comfortable bed, flat screen tv, tea service, and mini bar. The room was very quite, and you wouldn't have known you were so close to the airport. An overall enjoyable stay, price and location A1.
reviews.title: Basic Hotel, services your needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was a little slow but they had a big group of young South American girls just arrive. It was nice to see that all counter staff chipped in and worked the line. Internet pricing is disgustingly high and should be illegal to charge these sort of rates for a captive audience. I did choose not to use it as my International Data plan provided a cheaper alternative. Ate in the Asian self service restaurant and the curry was outstanding. Service was fine too.
reviews.title: Mold, bugs, and smells -- oh my!

reviews.text: The lobby was covered in white plastic, the decorations were grim, and the hallway smelled of stale cigarettes and industrial cleaners. Sadly, those were the best parts of this hotel. The room, and surrounding areas, were worn from what appeared to be a decent amount of abuse, and despite the small size of the room, it contained an amazing amount of flora and fauna. Really a rather diverse biosphere.
reviews.title: VERY POOR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Holiday inn for one night before our flight to Miami the hotel was a little difficult to find however when we arrived the staff were very helpful our room and our room was clean, we parked our car at the hotel while we were on holiday and at the price for parking and the night stay it was not more than parking at the airport, the shuttle bus from and too the hotel come every half hour and it does not cost that much when we retuned the car was in the parking bay that we left it.
reviews.title: Park and fly

reviews.text: Landed at Heathrow and jumped into a taxi for speed (£12) but think that we could have got the hoppa bus just as easy (£4 each). The first impression of the hotel is that it is a large, tall building, and people are always coming and going from this hotel. The car park is large, and I imagine it being chaos in the peak summer months.
reviews.title: Good For An Overnight But No More

reviews.text: The reception area was large, clean and bustling with activity. There was a small queue for check-in but we weren't waiting long at all, only a few minutes. Our room was a basic double room and It was actually much larger than I expected. We were several floors up and had quite a view from the window, in the distance you could see the planes departing and arriving, but the windows blocked out all sound ensuring a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: eww! it was so close to being great but it failed miserably

reviews.text: The bed had a choice of pillows labelled 'Firm' and 'Soft' common of Holiday Inn chain hotels. The large dressing table/desk which had a compartment that lifted up and revealed a mirror and a hair dryer.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but very pricy and charge additional fee for almost everything.

reviews.text: The bathroom was quite small, but it had a shower over bath combination, and toiletries were supplied along with plenty of towels. I found the bathroom to be nice and clean, and didn't see much in the way of mould.
reviews.title: Serves its purpose

aka: Holiday Inn London-Heathrow m4, Jct 4 Hotel
description: Contemporary and convenient, the Holiday Inn London Heathrow M4 J4 Hotel is just off the M4 motorway at Junction 4, minutes from Heathrow Airport, Terminal 5 and close to Stockley Business Park and Bedfont Lakes. Holiday Inn Heathrow M4 J4 is an ideal base to explore Central London, Legoland Windsor, Wembley and Twickenham. Holiday Inn London Heathrow M4 J4 offers Park, Stay & Go packages including one night's accommodations and car parking for up to 15days. Click hereAll bedrooms are spacious and equipped with air conditioning and high speed internet and wireless access throughout public areas.Our airport hotel is an ideal location for your meetings and conferences at Heathrow. 15 state of the art Academy meeting rooms are self-contained with dedicated and professional support. HSIA and WIFI available with unlimited Starbucks coffee.Workout & unwind in our complimentary Spirit Gym or indulge at one of the best Chinese and Thai restaurants at Heathrow Airport. Try our traditional Irish Pub or our lounge where refreshments are available 24 hours a day. The airport shuttle is 4 p/p each way.
